trans-unit.source: HBase tutorial: Get started with HBase in Hadoop | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: HBase tutorial: Get started with HBase in Hadoop | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Follow this HBase tutorial to get started using Apache HBase with Hadoop in HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Follow this HBase tutorial to get started using Apache HBase with Hadoop in HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Create tables from the HBase shell and query them using Hive.
trans-unit.target: Create tables from the HBase shell and query them using Hive.

trans-unit.source: HBase tutorial: Get started using Apache HBase with Hadoop in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: HBase tutorial: Get started using Apache HBase with Hadoop in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Learn how to provision an HBase cluster in HDInsight, create HBase tables, and query the tables by using Hive.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to provision an HBase cluster in HDInsight, create HBase tables, and query the tables by using Hive.

trans-unit.source: For general HBase information, see [HDInsight HBase overview][hdinsight-hbase-overview].
trans-unit.target: For general HBase information, see [HDInsight HBase overview][hdinsight-hbase-overview].

trans-unit.source: HBase tutorial: Get started using Apache HBase with Hadoop in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: HBase tutorial: Get started using Apache HBase with Hadoop in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] HBase (version 0.98.0) is only available for use with HDInsight 3.1 clusters on HDInsight (based on Apache Hadoop and YARN 2.4.0).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] HBase (version 0.98.0) is only available for use with HDInsight 3.1 clusters on HDInsight (based on Apache Hadoop and YARN 2.4.0).

trans-unit.source: For version information, see [What's new in the Hadoop cluster versions provided by HDInsight?][hdinsight-versions]
trans-unit.target: For version information, see [What's new in the Hadoop cluster versions provided by HDInsight?][hdinsight-versions]

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this HBase tutorial, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this HBase tutorial, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: **A Microsoft Azure subscription**.
trans-unit.target: **A Microsoft Azure subscription**.

trans-unit.source: See [Get Azure free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: See [Get Azure free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: **A workstation** with Visual Studio 2013: For instructions, see [Install Visual Studio](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/e2h7fzkw.aspx).
trans-unit.target: **A workstation** with Visual Studio 2013: For instructions, see [Install Visual Studio](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/e2h7fzkw.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Provision an HBase cluster
trans-unit.target: Provision an HBase cluster

trans-unit.source: To provision an HBase cluster by using the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: To provision an HBase cluster by using the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal][azure-management-portal].
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal][azure-management-portal].

trans-unit.source: Click **New** in the upper left corner, and then click **Data + Analytics**, **HDInsight**.
trans-unit.target: Click **New** in the upper left corner, and then click **Data + Analytics**, **HDInsight**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following values:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following values:

trans-unit.source: **Cluster Name** - enter a name to identify this cluster
trans-unit.target: **Cluster Name** - enter a name to identify this cluster

trans-unit.source: **Cluster Type** - HBase
trans-unit.target: **Cluster Type** - HBase

trans-unit.source: **Cluster Operating System** - the HDInsight HBase cluster currently only available on Windows operating system
trans-unit.target: **Cluster Operating System** - the HDInsight HBase cluster currently only available on Windows operating system

trans-unit.source: **Subscription** - select your Azure subscription used for provisioning this cluster
trans-unit.target: **Subscription** - select your Azure subscription used for provisioning this cluster

trans-unit.source: **Resource Group** - add or select an Azure resource group.
trans-unit.target: **Resource Group** - add or select an Azure resource group.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Azure Resource Manager Overview](resource-group-overview.md)
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Azure Resource Manager Overview](resource-group-overview.md)

trans-unit.source: **Configure the credentials** - for Windows based cluster, you can create a cluster user (a.k.a HTTP user, HTTP web service user) and a Remote Desktop user
trans-unit.target: **Configure the credentials** - for Windows based cluster, you can create a cluster user (a.k.a HTTP user, HTTP web service user) and a Remote Desktop user

trans-unit.source: **Data Source** - create a new Azure storage account or select an existing Azure storage account to be used as the default file system for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Data Source** - create a new Azure storage account or select an existing Azure storage account to be used as the default file system for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: This Azure Storage account must be in the same location as the HDInsight HBase cluster
trans-unit.target: This Azure Storage account must be in the same location as the HDInsight HBase cluster

trans-unit.source: **Note Pricing Tiers** - select the number of region servers for the HBase cluster
trans-unit.target: **Note Pricing Tiers** - select the number of region servers for the HBase cluster

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] For high availability of HBase services, you must provision a cluster that contains at least **three** nodes.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] For high availability of HBase services, you must provision a cluster that contains at least **three** nodes.

trans-unit.source: This ensures that, if one node goes down, the HBase data regions are available on other nodes.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that, if one node goes down, the HBase data regions are available on other nodes.

trans-unit.source: If you are learning HBase, always choose 1 for the cluster size, and delete the cluster after each use to reduce the cost.
trans-unit.target: If you are learning HBase, always choose 1 for the cluster size, and delete the cluster after each use to reduce the cost.

trans-unit.source: **Optional Configuration** - select the cluster version, configure Azure virtual network, configure Hive/Oozie metastore, configure Script actions, and add additional storage accounts.
trans-unit.target: **Optional Configuration** - select the cluster version, configure Azure virtual network, configure Hive/Oozie metastore, configure Script actions, and add additional storage accounts.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] After an HBase cluster is deleted, you can create another HBase cluster by using the same default blob container.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] After an HBase cluster is deleted, you can create another HBase cluster by using the same default blob container.

trans-unit.source: The new cluster will pick up the HBase tables you created in the original cluster.
trans-unit.target: The new cluster will pick up the HBase tables you created in the original cluster.

trans-unit.source: Use the HBase shell
trans-unit.target: Use the HBase shell

trans-unit.source: Currently, there are two way to access HBase.
trans-unit.target: Currently, there are two way to access HBase.

trans-unit.source: This section covers using the HBase shell.
trans-unit.target: This section covers using the HBase shell.

trans-unit.source: The next section covers using the .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: The next section covers using the .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: For most people, data appears in the tabular format:
trans-unit.target: For most people, data appears in the tabular format:

trans-unit.source: hdinsight hbase tabular data
trans-unit.target: hdinsight hbase tabular data

trans-unit.source: In HBase which is an implementation of BigTable, the same data looks like:
trans-unit.target: In HBase which is an implementation of BigTable, the same data looks like:

trans-unit.source: hdinsight hbase bigtable data
trans-unit.target: hdinsight hbase bigtable data

trans-unit.source: It'll make more sense after you finish the next procedure.
trans-unit.target: It'll make more sense after you finish the next procedure.

trans-unit.source: To use the HBase shell
trans-unit.target: To use the HBase shell

trans-unit.source: Use RDP to connect to your HBase cluster in HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Use RDP to connect to your HBase cluster in HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: For the RDP instructions, see [Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using the Azure Portal][hdinsight-manage-portal].
trans-unit.target: For the RDP instructions, see [Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using the Azure Portal][hdinsight-manage-portal].

trans-unit.source: Within your RDP session, click the **Hadoop Command Line** shortcut located on the desktop.
trans-unit.target: Within your RDP session, click the **Hadoop Command Line** shortcut located on the desktop.

trans-unit.source: Open the HBase shell:
trans-unit.target: Open the HBase shell:

trans-unit.source: Create an HBase with two column families:
trans-unit.target: Create an HBase with two column families:

trans-unit.source: Insert some data:
trans-unit.target: Insert some data:

trans-unit.source: hdinsight hadoop hbase shell
trans-unit.target: hdinsight hadoop hbase shell

trans-unit.source: Get a single row
trans-unit.target: Get a single row

trans-unit.source: You'll see the same results as using the scan command because there is only one row.
trans-unit.target: You'll see the same results as using the scan command because there is only one row.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Hbase table schema, see [Introduction to HBase Schema Design][hbase-schema].
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Hbase table schema, see [Introduction to HBase Schema Design][hbase-schema].

trans-unit.source: For more HBase commands, see [Apache HBase reference guide][hbase-quick-start].
trans-unit.target: For more HBase commands, see [Apache HBase reference guide][hbase-quick-start].

trans-unit.source: Exit the shell
trans-unit.target: Exit the shell

trans-unit.source: To bulk load data into the contacts HBase table
trans-unit.target: To bulk load data into the contacts HBase table

trans-unit.source: HBase includes several methods of loading data into tables.
trans-unit.target: HBase includes several methods of loading data into tables.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Bulk loading](http://hbase.apache.org/book.html#arch.bulk.load).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Bulk loading](http://hbase.apache.org/book.html#arch.bulk.load).

trans-unit.source: A sample data file has been uploaded to a public blob container, wasb://hbasecontacts@hditutorialdata.blob.core.windows.net/contacts.txt.
trans-unit.target: A sample data file has been uploaded to a public blob container, wasb://hbasecontacts@hditutorialdata.blob.core.windows.net/contacts.txt.

trans-unit.source: The content of the data file is:
trans-unit.target: The content of the data file is:

trans-unit.source: You can create a text file and upload the file to your own storage account if you want.
trans-unit.target: You can create a text file and upload the file to your own storage account if you want.

trans-unit.source: For the instructions, see [Upload data for Hadoop jobs in HDInsight][hdinsight-upload-data].
trans-unit.target: For the instructions, see [Upload data for Hadoop jobs in HDInsight][hdinsight-upload-data].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This procedure uses the Contacts HBase table you created in the last procedure.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This procedure uses the Contacts HBase table you created in the last procedure.

trans-unit.source: Within your RDP session, click the **Hadoop Command Line** shortcut located on the desktop.
trans-unit.target: Within your RDP session, click the **Hadoop Command Line** shortcut located on the desktop.

trans-unit.source: Change directory:
trans-unit.target: Change directory:

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to transform the data file to StoreFiles and store at a relative path specified by Dimporttsv.bulk.output:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to transform the data file to StoreFiles and store at a relative path specified by Dimporttsv.bulk.output:

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to upload the data from /example/data/storeDataFileOutput to the HBase table:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to upload the data from /example/data/storeDataFileOutput to the HBase table:

trans-unit.source: You can open the HBase shell, and use the scan command to list the table content.
trans-unit.target: You can open the HBase shell, and use the scan command to list the table content.

trans-unit.source: Check cluster status
trans-unit.target: Check cluster status

trans-unit.source: HBase in HDInsight ships with a Web UI for monitoring clusters.
trans-unit.target: HBase in HDInsight ships with a Web UI for monitoring clusters.

trans-unit.source: Using the Web UI, you can request statistics or information about regions.
trans-unit.target: Using the Web UI, you can request statistics or information about regions.

trans-unit.source: To open the Web UI, you must RDP into the cluster, and then click the HMaster Info Web UI shortcut on your desktop, or use the following URL in a web browser:
trans-unit.target: To open the Web UI, you must RDP into the cluster, and then click the HMaster Info Web UI shortcut on your desktop, or use the following URL in a web browser:

trans-unit.source: In a high availability cluster, you'll find a link to the current active HBase master node that is hosting the Web UI.
trans-unit.target: In a high availability cluster, you'll find a link to the current active HBase master node that is hosting the Web UI.

trans-unit.source: Use Hive to query HBase tables
trans-unit.target: Use Hive to query HBase tables

trans-unit.source: You can query data in HBase tables by using Hive.
trans-unit.target: You can query data in HBase tables by using Hive.

trans-unit.source: This section creates a Hive table that maps to the HBase table and uses it to query the data in your HBase table.
trans-unit.target: This section creates a Hive table that maps to the HBase table and uses it to query the data in your HBase table.

trans-unit.source: To open the cluster dashboard
trans-unit.target: To open the cluster dashboard

trans-unit.source: Browse to **https://<HDInsightClusterName>.azurehdinsight.net/**.
trans-unit.target: Browse to **https://<HDInsightClusterName>.azurehdinsight.net/**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Hadoop user account user name and password.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Hadoop user account user name and password.

trans-unit.source: The default user name is **admin** and the password is what you entered during the provisioning process.
trans-unit.target: The default user name is **admin** and the password is what you entered during the provisioning process.

trans-unit.source: A new browser tab opens.
trans-unit.target: A new browser tab opens.

trans-unit.source: Click **Hive Editor** at the top of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Hive Editor** at the top of the page.

trans-unit.source: The Hive Editor looks like this:
trans-unit.target: The Hive Editor looks like this:

trans-unit.source: HDInsight cluster dashboard.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight cluster dashboard.

trans-unit.source: To run Hive queries
trans-unit.target: To run Hive queries

trans-unit.source: Enter the following HiveQL script into Hive Editor and click **Submit** to create a Hive Table that maps to the HBase table.
trans-unit.target: Enter the following HiveQL script into Hive Editor and click **Submit** to create a Hive Table that maps to the HBase table.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you created the sample table referenced earlier in this tutorial by using the HBase shell before you run this statement.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you created the sample table referenced earlier in this tutorial by using the HBase shell before you run this statement.

trans-unit.source: Wait until the **Status** updates to **Completed**.
trans-unit.target: Wait until the **Status** updates to **Completed**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following HiveQL script into Hive Editor, and then click **Submit**.
trans-unit.target: Enter the following HiveQL script into Hive Editor, and then click **Submit**.

trans-unit.source: The Hive query queries the data in the HBase table:
trans-unit.target: The Hive query queries the data in the HBase table:

trans-unit.source: To retrieve the results of the Hive query, click the **View Details** link in the **Job Session** window when the job finishes running.
trans-unit.target: To retrieve the results of the Hive query, click the **View Details** link in the **Job Session** window when the job finishes running.

trans-unit.source: There will be only one job output file because you put one record into the HBase table.
trans-unit.target: There will be only one job output file because you put one record into the HBase table.

trans-unit.source: To browse the output file
trans-unit.target: To browse the output file

trans-unit.source: In the Query Console, click **File Browser**.
trans-unit.target: In the Query Console, click **File Browser**.

trans-unit.source: Click the Azure storage account that is used as the default file system for the HBase cluster.
trans-unit.target: Click the Azure storage account that is used as the default file system for the HBase cluster.

trans-unit.source: Click the HBase cluster name.
trans-unit.target: Click the HBase cluster name.

trans-unit.source: The default Azure storage account container uses the cluster name.
trans-unit.target: The default Azure storage account container uses the cluster name.

trans-unit.source: Click **User**, and then click **Admin**.
trans-unit.target: Click **User**, and then click **Admin**.

trans-unit.source: (This is the Hadoop user name.)
trans-unit.target: (This is the Hadoop user name.)

trans-unit.source: Click the job name with the **Last Modified** time that matches the time when the SELECT Hive query ran.
trans-unit.target: Click the job name with the **Last Modified** time that matches the time when the SELECT Hive query ran.

trans-unit.source: Click **stdout**.
trans-unit.target: Click **stdout**.

trans-unit.source: Save the file and open the file with Notepad.
trans-unit.target: Save the file and open the file with Notepad.

trans-unit.source: There will be one output file.
trans-unit.target: There will be one output file.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight HBase Hive Editor File Browser
trans-unit.target: HDInsight HBase Hive Editor File Browser

trans-unit.source: Use the .NET HBase REST API client library
trans-unit.target: Use the .NET HBase REST API client library

trans-unit.source: You must download the HBase REST API client library for .NET from GitHub and build the project so that you can use the HBase .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: You must download the HBase REST API client library for .NET from GitHub and build the project so that you can use the HBase .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: The following procedure includes the instructions for this task.
trans-unit.target: The following procedure includes the instructions for this task.

trans-unit.source: Create a new C# Visual Studio Windows Desktop Console application.
trans-unit.target: Create a new C# Visual Studio Windows Desktop Console application.

trans-unit.source: Open the NuGet Package Manager Console by clicking **Tools** > **NuGet Package Manager** > **Package Manager Console**.
trans-unit.target: Open the NuGet Package Manager Console by clicking **Tools** > **NuGet Package Manager** > **Package Manager Console**.

trans-unit.source: Run the following NuGet command in the console:
trans-unit.target: Run the following NuGet command in the console:

trans-unit.source: Add the following **using** statements at the top of the file:
trans-unit.target: Add the following **using** statements at the top of the file:

trans-unit.source: Replace the **Main** function with the following:
trans-unit.target: Replace the **Main** function with the following:

trans-unit.source: Set the first three variables in the **Main** function.
trans-unit.target: Set the first three variables in the **Main** function.

trans-unit.source: Press **F5** to run the application.
trans-unit.target: Press **F5** to run the application.

trans-unit.source: What's next?
trans-unit.target: What's next?

trans-unit.source: In this HBase tutorial for HDInsight, you learned how to provision an HBase cluster and how to create tables and view the data in those tables from the HBase shell.
trans-unit.target: In this HBase tutorial for HDInsight, you learned how to provision an HBase cluster and how to create tables and view the data in those tables from the HBase shell.

trans-unit.source: You also learned how use a Hive query on data in HBase tables and how to use the HBase C# REST APIs to create an HBase table and retrieve data from the table.
trans-unit.target: You also learned how use a Hive query on data in HBase tables and how to use the HBase C# REST APIs to create an HBase table and retrieve data from the table.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see:

trans-unit.source: [HDInsight HBase overview][hdinsight-hbase-overview].
trans-unit.target: [HDInsight HBase overview][hdinsight-hbase-overview].

trans-unit.source: HBase is an Apache, open-source, NoSQL database built on Hadoop that provides random access and strong consistency for large amounts of unstructured and semistructured data.
trans-unit.target: HBase is an Apache, open-source, NoSQL database built on Hadoop that provides random access and strong consistency for large amounts of unstructured and semistructured data.

trans-unit.source: [Provision HBase clusters on Azure Virtual Network][hdinsight-hbase-provision-vnet].
trans-unit.target: [Provision HBase clusters on Azure Virtual Network][hdinsight-hbase-provision-vnet].

trans-unit.source: With virtual network integration, HBase clusters can be deployed to the same virtual network as your applications so that applications can communicate with HBase directly.
trans-unit.target: With virtual network integration, HBase clusters can be deployed to the same virtual network as your applications so that applications can communicate with HBase directly.

trans-unit.source: [Configure HBase replication in HDInsight](hdinsight-hbase-geo-replication.md).
trans-unit.target: [Configure HBase replication in HDInsight](hdinsight-hbase-geo-replication.md).

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure HBase replication across two Azure datacenters.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure HBase replication across two Azure datacenters.

trans-unit.source: [Analyze Twitter sentiment with HBase in HDInsight][hbase-twitter-sentiment].
trans-unit.target: [Analyze Twitter sentiment with HBase in HDInsight][hbase-twitter-sentiment].

trans-unit.source: Learn how to do real-time [sentiment analysis](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sentiment_analysis) of big data by using HBase in a Hadoop cluster in HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to do real-time [sentiment analysis](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sentiment_analysis) of big data by using HBase in a Hadoop cluster in HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
